lrg_central_velocity_bias.json_critique: Contains sufficient detail to reproduce but lacks explicit output format or tolerance specification.
elg_hod_measurement_and_fitting.json_cri: Provides step-by-step guidance and even parameter lists that go beyond what is minimally required, effectively giving the agent a recipe rather than a specification.
elg_selection_count.json_critique: Includes extensive helper code and exact random-seed instructions that are not strictly necessary for defining the task.
lrg_hod_measurement_and_fitting.json_cri: Overspecified in the same manner as the ELG HOD task, reproducing large sections of the paper and prescribing the full procedure.
lrg_selection_count.json_critique: Mostly appropriate but still repeats large blocks of the paper and could specify desired output format more clearly.
elg_satellite_fraction.json_critique: Adequately specified; however, output formatting and tolerances are omitted.
lrg_satellite_fraction.json_critique: Same minor formatting/precision omissions as its ELG counterpart.
elg_satellite_velocity_bias.json_critiqu: Methodology is clear but output expectations are not fully defined and the halo–subhalo–particle mapping approximation may require further clarification.
lrg_clustering_secondary_bias_ratio.json: Underspecified for such a complex statistic: projection depth, binning, estimator choice, and required numerical precision are only loosely described, risking inconsistent implementations.
paper_critique: While every task is reproducible, most are either overspecified—quoting code and lengthy procedures—or, in the more complex cases, lack key implementation details.  The suite would benefit from tighter, output-oriented task descriptions and uniform formatting requirements.
paper_title: Illustrating galaxy-halo connection in the DESI era with ILLUSTRISTNG
